The film's performance is already outshining other releases.

GDP grew 8.2% in Q2, fastest in 6 quarters
description: India's economy surged by 8.2% in the July-September quarter, driven by a strong manufacturing rebound and robust services activity. This marks the fastest expansion in six quarters, with domestic demand fueling production ahead of the festival season. Economists now anticipate full-year growth to exceed 7%, bolstered by pro-growth policies and reforms.

JEE, NEET and CUET in Class XI? Reforms to cut dependence on coaching on cards
description: A central panel is proposing significant reforms to reduce student reliance on coaching centres. Key suggestions include holding competitive exams as early as Class XI, limiting daily coaching to two-three hours, and exploring a hybrid assessment model combining board performance with aptitude tests. These measures aim to ease academic pressure and re-emphasize school-based learning.

title: Maharashtra local polls: SC clears election process; 50% cap upheld
description: The Supreme Court has allowed the Maharashtra State Election Commission to proceed with elections for most local bodies, excluding those with over 50% reservation. Polls for 57 civic bodies exceeding this limit will be subject to the court's final decision on January 21, with results pending the outcome.

Harshita Brella case: UK police face misconduct proceedings; family demands answers
description: Four Northamptonshire police officers face misconduct proceedings for their handling of domestic abuse complaints made by Harshita Brella before her death. Brella reported abuse by her husband, Pankaj Lamba, who is accused of murdering her and fleeing to India. An investigation found that officers may not have adequately supported Brella, potentially contributing to the tragic outcome.

Utah Mammoth captain Clayton Keller honors late father
description: Utah Mammoth captain Clayton Keller, despite the sudden passing of his father, Bryan, chose to play the very next day against the Dallas Stars. This decision highlights his profound loyalty and inner strength, honoring his father while supporting his team. Coach Andre Tourigny emphasized the organization's unwavering support for Keller, underscoring their family-first approach.

title: ‘Staggering damage’: Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
description: Over 1,000 Amazon employees have signed an open letter warning of dire consequences from the company's rapid AI development. They argue Amazon is sacrificing climate goals and its human workforce for AI dominance, citing increased emissions, water consumption for data centers, and job displacement. The workers demand ethical AI practices, including clean energy use and employee involvement in AI decisions.

title: SC: Will frame rules, menstrual shaming must end, period.
description: The Supreme Court is set to frame guidelines to protect women's health, dignity, and privacy concerning menstruation, prompted by an incident where sanitation workers were forced to prove they were menstruating. The court expressed concern over 'period-shaming' and issued notices to the Centre, acknowledging the SCBA's petition highlighting widespread such violations.

description: A pilot's final words, "Cannot see anything, turning…", preceded a fatal helicopter crash near Gaurikund en route to Kedarnath. The Aryan Aviation Bell 407, flying in unpredictable cloud banks, lost visibility and hit a hillside, killing all seven on board. The incident highlights significant weather monitoring shortcomings.

title: Lane Kiffin’s final Ole Miss game clouded by shocking 3am locker-room incident

This occurred amidst intense speculation about Kiffin's future with the program.

No ‘good’ AQI in major cities: 10-year study flags persistent pollution; Delhi tops list
description: A decade-long study reveals no major Indian city met safe air quality standards between 2015 and November 2025. Delhi consistently ranked as the most polluted, with other cities also experiencing unhealthy AQI levels. Vehicular emissions, industrial pollution, and crop burning are identified as key contributors, exacerbated by geographical factors and weather patterns.

The film that changed everything: Rohini’s journey from classroom dreams to cinema
description: Actor Rohini who has acted in several Tamil, Telugu, and Malayalam films like Baahubali and Dude, is nothing short of prolific. In this podcast, she speaks about how her mother’s death impacted her life. Having gotten past a difficult childhood where acting was not a choice but an imposition, Rohini speaks of finding her dramatic flair, her philosophy that revolves around happiness, and her escape from cinema’s imposing male gaze. As a connoisseur of world cinema, she also recommends films and books that she goes back. What keeps her going? She answers in this edition of This Changed My Life.

Understanding Type 5 diabetes and how it differs from other types
description: A new form of diabetes, Type 5, linked to chronic malnutrition, is emerging globally, particularly in low-income regions. Unlike other types, it stems from impaired pancreatic development due to nutrient deficiencies, affecting younger individuals who are often underweight. Early detection and tailored management are crucial to combat its serious complications.

description: India has achieved 'major power' status, ranking third in Asia according to the Lowy Institute's Power Index. This rise is attributed to its growing economic and military strengths, notably boosted by recent combat experience in Operation Sindoor. While India leads Japan and Russia, a significant gap remains with China and the US, the top two superpowers.

title: Maoists offer to disarm by Jan 1; want ops halted; seek safe reintegration
description: Maoist cadres in Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, and Chhattisgarh are ready to lay down arms by January 1, 2026, seeking clear security guarantees and a transparent rehabilitation process. The MMC Special Zonal Committee proposes a collective, organized reunification, not individual surrenders, emphasizing safety for cadres and their families. This offer coincides with intensified anti-Maoist operations and a Union government deadline.

title: How to improve blood circulation in legs naturally
description: Maintaining good leg circulation is vital for overall vascular health, preventing issues like swelling and pain. Natural approaches include exercise, dietary adjustments, and lifestyle changes. Specific exercises, leg elevation, compression, and a diet rich in antioxidants and fiber significantly improve blood flow and vascular function.

title: Nick Fuentes demands proof after Candace Owens links Macron, Kirk to plot
description: Candace Owens' explosive claims on X, alleging French President Macron and his wife paid for her assassination and French Legion soldiers killed Charlie Kirk, have been met with skepticism. Right-wing commentator Nick Fuentes publicly demanded proof, calling her stories 'crazy' and lacking evidence, particularly mocking her claims about Brigitte Macron's family history and gender.

title: Google chips threaten Nvidia: Stock drops $250bn; claims 'we lead industry'
description: Nvidia's stock plummeted by $250 billion after reports surfaced of Meta Platforms considering significant spending on Google's competing AI chips. This move signals a potential shift in the AI hardware market, with Google's TPUs emerging as a credible alternative to Nvidia's dominant position.
